snippet: South Korean prosecutors indicted Park Jung-geun, a social media and freedom of speech activist this week for reposting messages from the North Korean government’s Twitter account.
abstract: South Korean prosecutors indict Park Jung-geun, a social media and freedom of speech activist, for reposting messages from the North Korean government’s Twitter account that he claimed were meant to be satirical; Park was detained in January on charges of violating South Korea’s controversial National Security Law, which bans 'acts that benefit the enemy'--North Korea—but does not clearly define what constitutes such acts.
lead_paragraph: South Korean prosecutors indicted Park Jung-geun, a social media and freedom of speech activist this week for reposting messages from the North Korean government’s Twitter account.

headline.seo: South Korea Indicts Park Jung-geun Over Twitter Posts
headline.main: South Korean Indicted Over Twitter Posts From North
headline.print_headline: South Korean Indicted for Posting North’s Views
